pros: Good staff and pay for new grad
cons: Low staffing and there are no bonuses

pros: Work colleagues can be come like family
cons: There is a lot of favoritism. People who are good looking get promoted to positions they aren't even qualified for. Director of the hospital is unprofessional. Don't get caught up in the drama. People are always in your business. Pay is garbage for the work you do.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Montebello, CA
pros: Great Camaraderie and teamwork, gained good experience to find a better job to suffer in.
cons: Experience, patient population, low pay, no resources, outdated systems

pros: Some of my bills get paid
cons: Management definitely sucks at everything

pros: Pros? Absolutely none. Search for a new opportunity
cons: Upper leadership looks to place blame and not correct unsafe and dangerous situations/ they live to blame travel nurses. Unable to hire new grads, they quit asap. Doctors are incompetent and spend 2 minutes with patient/ very quick to dismiss patients and re-admit them. Multiple mal-practice issues that are not caught or addressed. Often times nurses are over ratio and stressed to the max, only 1 CNA on the floor

pros: easy and relax workplace coz nobody watch you easy to apply and get hired
cons: poor management, unorganized, low pay, lack of resources

pros: Everyone knows each other and people help each other.
cons: The higher management are not very supportive.

pros: Hours are flexible, you pretty much work by yourself in the afternoon and graveyard. Co workers are nice. Very little drama
cons: I worked per diem, but at some poitn was working part time/ full time with no benefits.

review_title: Low pay, high nurse to patient ratio

cons: High nurse to patient ratio, low pay, benefits suck

pros: Flexible schedule. Staff is great to work with.
cons: Low pay. No room to advance

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Montebello, CA
pros: Very flexible in regards to schedule. Gives new grads opportunity. Friendly/helpful staff depending on which floor you are on.
cons:
Pay is not comparable to other hospitals
Workload for the amount of pay. 
expecting you to clock out on time with increasing work/charting without helping to increase efficiency or staff to help. 
Management.
Benefits.
No opportunity for advancement. 
Very into saving money which equals to outdated/poor equipment.
Lots of blaming and figure pointing instead of figuring out ways to decrease cases of error. 
Gossiping. If someone makes error, everyone in hospital or at least the floor, will know about it

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Montebello, CA
pros: The staff is friendly and helpful.
cons: Occasional lack of resources, management can seem unappreciative and unaccommodating to employee's plights.

pros: It was near my home and I was able to get to work without traffice.
cons: Management is inconsistent and it is very stressful to work there.

job_title: Staff RN II in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Small hospital that cares about its community

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Montebello, CA
pros: Great place to start and accelerate in the nursing profession.
cons: The structure of management is unconventional and lacks proper resources.

pros: The people were great to work with; felt like family.
cons: The work was more than it should compared to other places.

review_title: Culturally diverse, family oriented but lack a sense of unity
pros:
1.Private single bedrooms for patients, however, they are only able to accommodate 2-3 more people for family visiting
2. Pt communicates mostly in Spanish, a great way to push yourself to learn Spanish
3. Friendly and helpful coworkers
cons:
1. It gets annoying since majority of nurses speak their native tongue other than English most of the time.
2. Even with smaller room capacity, visiting families will crowd the bedrooms even they were warned. 
3. Nursing managers/supervisors tend to have favorites and bias toward co-workers

pros: We all work together as a team. No one, no matter the job title, is lesser than the other. I feel like we are all family. Many nurses and support staff have been there for over 20 years!! Why? Because it's an excellent place to work.
cons: When I think of something, I'll be sure to jot it down.

pros: Small Community Hospital with ample opportunity to cross train and lead projects, as well as work with leadership team and on-the-ground staff.  Learning opportunities are what you make of them.
cons: Budget constraints of a smaller non-profit hospital.  Challenges of reaching a low income community.

pros: The pros are you would have a job
cons: Executive management is not ethical and do not support their employees. Not a good place to work.
